column2: Tesco and Knowsley Council talks

column1: Good progress is being made on ambitious plans for the proposed
and a new stadium for Everton Football Club in Kirkby.

column2: Tesco and Everton Football Club have been

column1: involved in an exclusivity agreement for several months with a view
to deciding whether to go ahead with proposals for a new retail
centre and football stadium in Kirkby Town Centre. At a recent high

column2: it was agreed to move to the next stage which is to

column1: start a major consultation process on the proposals for residents
Early indications suggest that the proposed development would

column2: 000 jobs in the town. Of this total
boosting Kirkby’s economy by up to

column1: £21.5m per year and significantly driving down unemployment
Discussions have also been taking place with the owners of the
existing town centre as the Council is hoping to consult on an
all-encompassing town centre regeneration plan. The owners of the
existing town centre have already expressed a strong interest in
getting involved in any proposed development to the benefit of
the next stage in realising this ambitious proposal is being
reached. This is a major opportunity for Kirkby to be transformed
into a premier leisure and retail destination for the region. The

column2: not just to the people of
but to Knowsley and the wider area."

column1: pleased with the progress that has been made to date. Although
there is still a lot of work to be done
column2: my priority now is to make

column1: sure that anyone with an interest is given an opportunity to tell
us what they think should happen in Kirkby before any plans are
submitted by the developer. I hope to start that consultation

column2: and could result in the development of one of

column1: the most successful retail centres in the country
stadium which would provide significant economic benefits for the
area. This project is one of the most innovative schemes that Tesco

column2: and we are really looking forward to

column1: speaking to the community to explain our ideas.”
have been fully exploring our options for the future for some
considerable time now. Talks with both Knowsley Borough Council and
Tesco are continuing and we are encouraged by the progress which
has been made. We hope to be in a position to deliver more news
more information to our supporters in the not-too-distant
This is a joint media release from Knowsley Council
